"QR code" widget
The "QR Code" Widget
is designed for creating and displaying QR codes that can be used to:
Navigate to a specified link;
Fill an attribute with entered text;
Call a specified phone number;
Send a message to a specified email address;
Navigate to a required system object.
Example of a customized widget:
Setup
Adding the widget to an object profile is performed in the
visual
editing mode. On the "Elements" panel, navigate to the "Widgets" tab and from the "User Information" section, drag and drop the "QR Code" widget into the workspace of the profile.
After clicking the
button, a modal window for configuring the widget’s
parameters
will open. Alternatively, if the system contains previously configured QR code settings objects, the following modal window will appear:
Selection of a previously created settings object is available in the dropdown list; creation of a new one is performed by clicking the
button.
Parameters
Through the widget parameters:
The name of the widget settings object is specified;
By default, it is populated as "QR Code Settings".
The
QR code content
is defined;
The
QR code styling
is configured.
In the lower part of the settings window, the preview field displays the result of the configured QR code.
QR Code Content
The result of scanning the QR code depends on its content settings. The following options are available:
Link — an option where the QR code will store a link for navigation.
Setting
Purpose
Static/Algorithm
Selecting the method for passing the link into the QR code.
URL
Inserting/inputing of a static link.
This field is displayed when using the static link passing method.
Link definition algorithm
Defining an algorithm that will return the link.
Selection of a previously created algorithm of type "Algorithm. Object Cards" is made from a dropdown list; adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
The algorithm runs based on the object whose visual contains the widget.
This field is displayed when passing the link via an algorithm.
Scanning the configured QR code or clicking the link that appears when hovering over the QR code will navigate to the specified link.
When hovering over the QR code, the URL can be copied using the
button.
Text — an option where the QR code will contain a text message.
Setting
Purpose
Static/Algorithm
Selecting the method for passing text into the QR code.
Text
Inserting/inputting a text message.
Maximum allowed number of characters is 1000.
This field is displayed when using the static text passing method.
Text Definition Algorithm
Defining an algorithm that will return the text.
Selection of a previously created algorithm of type "Algorithm. Object Cards" is made from a dropdown list; adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
The algorithm runs based on the object whose visual contains the widget.
This field is displayed when passing text via an algorithm.
Scanning the configured QR code will open the user’s search service, where the specified text will be used as the search query.
When hovering over the QR code, the text can be copied using the
button.
Phone — an option where the QR code will contain a phone number.
Setting
Purpose
Static/Algorithm
Selecting the method for passing the phone number into the QR code.
Phone
Inserting/inputting a phone number.
This field is displayed when using the static phone number passing method.
Phone number definition algorithm
Defining an algorithm that will return the phone number.
Selection of a previously created algorithm of type "Algorithm. Object Cards" is made from a dropdown list; adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
The algorithm runs based on the object whose visual contains the widget.
This field is displayed when passing the phone number via an algorithm.
Scanning the configured QR code or clicking the phone number that appears when hovering over the QR code will open the calling application with the specified number pre-filled.
When hovering over the QR code, the phone number can be copied using the
button.
Email — an option where the QR code will contain an email address.
Setting
Purpose
Static/Algorithm
Selecting the method for passing the email into the QR code.
Email
Inserting/inputting an email address.
This field is displayed when using the static email passing method.
Email definition algorithm
Defining an algorithm that will return the email address.
Selection of a previously created algorithm of type "Algorithm. Object Cards" is made from a dropdown list; adding a new
algorithm
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
The algorithm runs based on the object whose visual contains the widget.
This field is displayed when passing the email via an algorithm.
Scanning the configured QR code or clicking the email that appears when hovering over the QR code will open the user’s email client, where the specified address will be automatically populated in the recipient field.
When hovering over the QR code, the email can be copied using the
button.
System object link — an option where the QR code will contain a link to open a menu item page, object, or object registry.
Setting
Purpose
Menu Item/Object/Registry
The system object that needs to be accessed via the QR code.
Menu Item
Selecting the
menu item
whose link will be stored in the QR code.
This field is displayed when "Menu Item" is selected as the system object to open.
Object Type
Defining the object type whose object link will be contained in the QR code.
Selecting of a previously created object type is made from a dropdown list; adding a
new type
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
This field is displayed when "Object" or "Registry" is selected as the system object to open.
Object
Defining the object whose link will be contained in the QR code.
Selection of a previously created object is made from a dropdown list; adding a
new object
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
This field is displayed when "Object" is selected as the system object to open.
Visual
Defining the instance visual for the selected object type.
Selecting a previously created visual is made from a dropdown list; adding a
new visual
is available through the parameter’s action menu.
If no value is specified, the default visual is used.
This field is displayed when "Object" is selected as the system object to open.
Registry
Defining the registry visual for the selected object type.
Selection of a previously created
registry visual
is made from a dropdown list; creating a new one or editing the selected one is available through the parameter’s action menu.
This field is displayed when "Registry" is selected as the system object to open.
Scanning the configured QR code or clicking the button that appears when hovering over the QR code will open the system object specified in the widget settings.
QR Code Styling
QR code styling is configured using the following parameters:
Parameter
Purpose
Shape
Selecting the shape of the area where the QR code is placed - square or circle.
Width (px)
Definition of the QR code width in pixels.
Accepts integer values from 100 to 2000.
Default QR code width is 200px.
Background Color
Selecting the background color for the QR code, defined using a color picker component.
Foreground Color
Selecting the QR code color, defined using a color picker component.
Background Image
Adding an image as a background for the QR code.
The image can be uploaded via a button or dragged into the parameter area. When adding via button, the upload method is selected: from disk or from the system.
When adding an image from disk, a new instance of type "File" [FS_FILE] is created in the System.
Image files in *.jpg, *.png, or *.jpeg formats can be used.
This parameter is displayed when the "Circle" shape is selected.
Border
Boolean parameter defining whether to add a stroke around the area where the QR code is placed.
Default value is "No".
Thickness (px)
Border thickness.
Default value is 2.
This parameter is available when the QR code has a stroke.
Color
Border color.
This parameter is available when the QR code has a stroke.
Logo
Adding a logo to the center of the QR code.
The logo can be uploaded via a button or dragged into the parameter area. When adding via button, the upload method is selected: from disk or from the system.
When adding a logo from disk, a new instance of type "File" [FS_FILE] is created in the System.
Logo files in *.jpg, *.png, or *.jpeg formats can be used.
Hint
Boolean parameter defining whether to add a hint for the user.
Hint text
Inserting/inputting of hint text to be placed below the QR code.
Maximum hint text size is 200 characters.
This field is displayed when the "Hint" parameter is active.
Use example
For example, on the visual of an object containing news about an upcoming webinar, a QR code needs to be placed for navigating to a page with contact details.
To do this, in the
visual
editing mode of the instance, drag and drop the "QR Code" widget into the workspace.
Next, navigate to the widget settings by clicking the
button and define the following configuration parameters:
In this case, navigation to the contacts page is required, so "Link" should be selected as the QR code content, and the static URL should be specified in the corresponding field.
The QR code styling can be configured according to preferences or corporate style.
For adding a logo, an image without a background in *.png format can be used.
